organic_results.title: On the accuracy of children's reports of family social status
organic_results.snippet: A systematic comparison is presented of the reports by school-age boys of their parents' educational level and their fathers' occupations with the reports of these same characteristics by the parents. Both black and white boys in the sixth, ninth, and twelfth grades are included. We find little general evidence of serious loss due to nonresponse, although the loss tends to be somewhat larger among blacks at all grade levels. Our regression and correlation analyses suggest that:(a) boys in higher grades are more …

publication_info.summary: AC Kerckhoff, WM Mason, SS Poss - Sociology of Education, 1973 - JSTOR
